description.narrative:
Detta är ett tilläggsbeslut till insatsbeslut 4/2018 och tilläggsbeslut 13/2020 och rör en förlängning av aktivitetsperioden av Sidas pågående kapacitetshöjande stöd till funktioner inom Kambodjas parlament. Kambodja inledde år 2004 en reform med syfte att stärka den offentliga finansiella styrningen (OFS). Reformen har finansierats av flera givare, däribland EU och Sida. Sedan 2011 har PIC fått svenskt stöd för att stödja genomförandet av sin verksamhet som bl.a. syftar till att bygga upp parlamentets analys- och utredningskapacitet. Det svenska stödet lämnas som ett kärnstöd till PIC:s nationella verksamhet.
Den senaste perioden som Sida stödjer med en total budget om MSEK 16,5 genomförs under perioden 2018-2020. Detta tilläggsbeslut innefattar en förlängning av aktivitetsperioden som egentligen ska avslutas 31 december 2020 men nu föreslås omfatta perioden fram till ock med 31 mars 2021. Tilläggsbeslutet innefattar inget tillskott av medel.
Stödet under perioden 2018-2020 och även under förlängningen till 31 mars 2021 är ett stöd till PIC:s Kambodja-verksamhet som bl.a. syftar till att stärka parlamentets förmåga att anlysera statsbudgeten. Insatsen omfattar fortsatta utbildningsaktiviteter och fältbesök ute i landet, där parlamentarikernas kontakter med medborgarna står i fokus. Nätverkande och studiebesök vid andra parlament i regionen och/eller andra delar av världen ingår också men behöver sedan corona-pandemins start i början av 2020 ske online. PIC håller också på att omorganiseras för att även utöka sin regionala verksamhet till att omfatta liknande stöd som i Kambodja även till Myanmar, Laos och Vietnam. Detta kommer att ske genom att överföra PIC:s nuvarande verksamhet till en nystartad NGO som ska heta PCAsia fr o m 1 april 2021. En del av PIC:s verksamhet under förlängningen kommer att fokusera på denna omorganisation.

This is a supplementary decision to decision 4/2018 and supplementary decision 13/2020. It concerns an extension of the activity period of Sida's ongoing capacity enhancing support for functions within Cambodia's parliament. In 2004, Cambodia launched a reform aimed at strengthening public financial management (OFS). The reform has been funded by several donors, inluding the EU and Sida. Since 2011, PIC has received Swedish financing to support the implementation of its activities, which e.g. aims to build up the Cambodian Parliament's analytical and investigative capacity. The Swedish support is provided as core support to PIC's national operations.
The current Sida financing is SEK 16.5 which is being implemented during the period 2018-2020. This additional decision includes an extension of the activity period from 31 December 2020, up to and including 31 March 2021. The supplementary decision does not include any additional funding.
The support during the period 2018-2020 and also during the extension up to 31 March 2021 is a support to PIC's Cambodia operations which, among other things, aims to strengthen Parliament's ability to analyze the state budget. The initiative includes continued training activities and field visits out in the country, where the parliamentarians' contacts with the citizens are in focus. Networking and study visits to other parliaments in the region and/or other parts of the world are also included, but need to take place online since the start of the corona pandemic in early 2020. The PIC is also being reorganized to extend its regional operations ti include similar support, through peer learning and exchange, to Myanmar, Laos and Vietnam. This will be done by transferring PIC's current operations to a newly started NGO called PCAsia from 1 April 2021. A part of PIC's operations during the extension will focus on this reorganization.

title.narrative: Decision on Contribution, Parliamentary Institute of Cambodia 2018-2020

description.narrative: The main area of work for PIC consists of building the research capacity of the Research Departments of the General Secretaries of the Cambodian Parliament. Thereby the professionalism of the parliamentary staff is enhanced, and they are better able to offer quality research services to parliamentarians and the parliamentary commissions. Over the years, 35 interns (who are staff at NA and the senate, and out of which 49% are women) have been trained in parliamentary research. The main areas where PIC offers training to the parliamentary staff is parliamentary research methodology, analytical skills, legislative analysis and English in order for the Research Department to eventually be able to produce neutral and technically based research papers. The other main area of work for PIC is to produce the so-called research papers upon requests of individual parliamentarians or of parliamentary commissions. More than 200 such research products on a wide range of topics have been produced by PIC and/or parliamentary staff mentored by PIC. By doing so, parliamentarians have been provided with concise and unbiased information which in turn has given them a better understanding of key issues and enabled them to use this knowledge to question relevant departments and ministries. Since the establishment of PIC, the demand of research products by parliamentarians have increased, demonstrating their willingness to deepen their knowledge on key issues in order to improve their constitutional roles.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
